description: CEC 2022 vs NEC 2023 comprehensive test suite - 30 questions focusing on California-specific differences and CEC table lookups

questions.question: What are the panelboard space requirements for single-family dwellings in California? What appliances must have reserved circuit breaker spaces?
questions.expected_answer: CEC 408.2(A) requires panelboards in single-family dwellings to have reserved spaces for branch circuits for: (1) heat pump water heaters, (2) heat pump space heaters, (3) electric cooktops, and (4) electric clothes dryers, as specified in California Energy Code Section 150.0(n), (t), (u), and (v). This is a California-specific requirement for electrification readiness. Note: EV charging requirements are separate and found in CEC Article 625 and Title 24 CALGreen, not in CEC 408.2.
questions.notes: Major California-unique requirement for electrification readiness

questions.question: What are California's electrical requirements for EV charging infrastructure in new residential construction?
questions.expected_answer: California requires EV-ready infrastructure in new construction including dedicated 40-amp minimum circuits, conduit to parking spaces, and panel capacity for EV loads. These requirements are found in CEC Article 625 and Title 24 CALGreen (not CEC 408.2). Title 24 CALGreen mandates EV charging readiness with specific requirements for EV Capable, EV Ready, and installed EVCS spaces.
questions.notes: California leads in EV infrastructure mandates

questions.question: What are the California-specific electrical requirements for solar PV systems on new residential construction?
questions.expected_answer: California mandates solar PV on new single-family homes (Title 24 Part 6). Electrical requirements include rapid shutdown per CEC 690.12, arc-fault protection per CEC 690.11, specific grounding requirements per 690.41-47, and multiple disconnecting means requirements.
questions.notes: California mandates solar, NEC only covers installation

questions.question: What circuit requirements does California have for heat pump water heaters in new dwelling units?
questions.expected_answer: Per CEC 408.2, panelboards must have a reserved space for a heat pump water heater branch circuit. This is part of California's decarbonization requirements to ensure electrical infrastructure can support heat pump water heaters as replacements for gas water heaters.

questions.question: What is required for electric cooktop readiness in new California homes?
questions.expected_answer: CEC 408.2 requires panelboards to have a reserved space for electric cooktop branch circuits. This ensures homes are ready for all-electric cooking appliances as part of California's building electrification requirements.

questions.question: What are the panelboard requirements for electric clothes dryer circuits in California new construction?
questions.expected_answer: CEC 408.2 requires panelboards to have a reserved space for electric clothes dryer branch circuits in single-family dwellings. This is a California-specific requirement for building electrification.

questions.question: What does CEC Table 240.4(G) specify that is unique to California?
questions.expected_answer: CEC Table 240.4(G) is a California-only table that provides additional overcurrent protection requirements. This table does not exist in the base NEC 2023.

questions.question: What does CEC Table 242.3 specify for California installations?
questions.expected_answer: CEC Table 242.3 is a California-only table related to surge protection requirements. This table does not exist in the base NEC 2023.

questions.question: What does CEC Table 430.72(B) specify for motor control circuit overcurrent protection?
questions.expected_answer: CEC Table 430.72(B) specifies maximum ratings of overcurrent protective devices for motor control circuits based on conductor size and configuration. It includes columns for separate protection, conductors within enclosure, and conductors extending beyond enclosure for both copper and aluminum conductors.

questions.question: What medium voltage cable tables does California have that are not in the NEC?
questions.expected_answer: CEC has 18 medium voltage tables in the 311.60(C) series (Tables 311.60(C)(67) through 311.60(C)(86)) that are California-only. These provide ampacity information for medium voltage cables not found in the base NEC.

questions.question: What is the ampacity of 4/0 AWG copper conductor at 75C according to California electrical code?
questions.expected_answer: 230 amperes per CEC 2022 Table 310.16 [California Amendment]
questions.notes: CEC delta table - verify correct lookup

questions.question: What size equipment grounding conductor is required for a 200A circuit in California?
questions.expected_answer: 6 AWG copper or 4 AWG aluminum per CEC 2022 Table 250.122 [California Amendment]

questions.question: What size grounding electrode conductor is required for a 3/0 AWG copper service conductor in California?
questions.expected_answer: 4 AWG copper or 2 AWG aluminum GEC per CEC 2022 Table 250.66 [California Amendment]

questions.question: What is the temperature correction factor for a 75C rated conductor at 40C ambient temperature according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 0.88 per CEC 2022 Table 310.15(B)(1)(1) [California Amendment]

questions.question: What is the ampacity adjustment factor for 7-9 current-carrying conductors in a raceway according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 70% (0.70) per CEC 2022 Table 310.15(C)(1) [California Amendment]

questions.question: What is the minimum working space depth for a 480V panelboard under Condition 3 according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 1.2 m (4 ft) per CEC 2022 Table 110.26(A)(1)

questions.question: What type of enclosure is suitable for outdoor use with rain, sleet, and ice according to California code Table 110.28?
questions.expected_answer: Type 3, 3R, 3S, 4, 4X, 6, or 6P enclosures are suitable for outdoor use with rain, sleet, and ice per CEC 2022 Table 110.28 [California Amendment]

questions.question: What is the general lighting load in VA per square foot for office buildings according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 1.3 VA per square foot per CEC 2022 Table 220.12 (updated from 3.5 VA in NEC 2020)
questions.notes: CEC delta table - commercial lighting load

questions.question: What is the ampacity of a 12 AWG flexible cord (Column B thermoset) according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 25 amperes per CEC 2022 Table 400.5(A)(1). Note: This is the same value as NEC 2023 - there is no California amendment for this table. Column B represents 2 current-carrying conductors.
questions.notes: CEC and NEC have identical values for flexible cord ampacity

questions.question: What is the maximum operating temperature for Type SF-2 silicone insulated fixture wire according to California code?
questions.expected_answer: 200C (392F) per CEC 2022 Table 402.3 [California Amendment]

questions.question: Calculate the adjusted ampacity for 8 AWG THWN copper conductors with 7 conductors in a raceway at 40C ambient temperature in California.
questions.expected_answer: Base ampacity: 50A (CEC Table 310.16, 75C). Temperature correction: 0.88 (CEC Table 310.15(B)(1)(1) for 40C). Bundling factor: 0.70 (CEC Table 310.15(C)(1) for 7-9 conductors). Adjusted ampacity = 50 x 0.88 x 0.70 = 30.8A

questions.question: Size the conductors, EGC, and GEC for a 200A residential service in California using copper conductors.
questions.expected_answer: Service conductors: 3/0 AWG copper minimum (200A at 75C per CEC Table 310.16). Equipment grounding conductor: 6 AWG copper (per CEC Table 250.122 for 200A). Grounding electrode conductor: 4 AWG copper (per CEC Table 250.66 for 3/0 service conductors).

questions.question: Calculate the general lighting load for a 5,000 square foot office building in California.
questions.expected_answer: Per CEC Table 220.12, office buildings require 1.3 VA per square foot (updated from 3.5 VA in NEC 2017 and earlier). General lighting load = 5,000 sq ft x 1.3 VA/sq ft = 6,500 VA (6.5 kVA). Note: The 125% continuous load multiplier is already included in this table value.

questions.question: What is the maximum overcurrent protection for a motor control circuit using 16 AWG copper conductors that extend beyond the enclosure in California?
questions.expected_answer: Per CEC Table 430.72(B), Column C for conductors extending beyond enclosure, 16 AWG copper has a maximum OCP rating of 10 amperes.

questions.question: Calculate the general lighting load for a 2,400 square foot dwelling unit in California.
questions.expected_answer: Per CEC Table 220.12, dwelling units require 3 VA per square foot. General lighting load = 2,400 sq ft x 3 VA/sq ft = 7,200 VA (7.2 kVA).

questions.question: Compare the kitchen GFCI requirements between CEC 2022 and NEC 2023. Which code is more restrictive?
questions.expected_answer: CEC 2022 is MORE PERMISSIVE than NEC 2023 for kitchen GFCI. CEC limits GFCI requirements to receptacles serving countertop surfaces and within 6 feet of the sink. NEC 2023 requires GFCI protection for ALL kitchen receptacles, including those for refrigerators and built-in microwaves.
questions.notes: CEC is more permissive for kitchen GFCI

questions.question: Compare the panelboard space requirements between CEC 2022 and NEC 2023 for single-family dwellings.
questions.expected_answer: CEC 2022 Section 408.2(A) requires reserved panelboard spaces for: (1) heat pump water heaters, (2) heat pump space heaters, (3) electric cooktops, and (4) electric clothes dryers. NEC 2023 has NO such requirement. This is a significant California-specific difference for building electrification. Note: EV charging requirements are in CEC Article 625 and Title 24 CALGreen, not in CEC 408.2.

questions.question: Compare California's EV charging infrastructure requirements with the NEC 2023 requirements.
questions.expected_answer: California (CEC + Title 24) MANDATES EV charging infrastructure in new construction, requiring dedicated circuits, conduit, and panel capacity. NEC 2023 Article 625 only provides installation rules for EV charging equipment but does not mandate installation. California leads with proactive requirements.

questions.question: Compare the AFCI protection requirements between CEC 2022 and NEC 2023 for dwelling units.
questions.expected_answer: Both CEC 2022 and NEC 2023 require AFCI protection for 120V, 15/20A branch circuits in kitchens, family rooms, dining rooms, living rooms, bedrooms, sunrooms, closets, hallways, laundry areas, and similar rooms. The requirements are largely similar between the two codes.

questions.question: Compare California's solar PV requirements with NEC 2023 Article 690.
questions.expected_answer: California MANDATES solar PV on new single-family homes through Title 24 Part 6. CEC 690 follows NEC 690 for installation requirements (rapid shutdown, arc-fault protection, grounding). The key difference is California requires solar installation; NEC only covers how to install it safely.
questions.notes: CA mandates solar, NEC only installation rules
